item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 18, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. France Becomes First Government to Endorse UN Open Source Principles (80 points | 15 comments)
2. Spaced repetition systems have gotten better (646 points | 404 comments)
3. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (257 points | 69 comments)
4. Ditching Obsidian and building my own (200 points | 236 comments)
5. Show HN: Vaev – A browser engine built from scratch (It renders google.com) (95 points | 38 comments)
6. $30 Homebrew Automated Blinds Opener (153 points | 61 comments)
7. Spaced Repetition Memory System (136 points | 12 comments)
8. Hyper Typing (37 points | 31 comments)
9. I built a platform to find tech conferences, discounts, and ticket giveaways (17 points | 10 comments)
10. K-Scale Labs: Open-source humanoid robots, built for developers (37 points | 25 comments)
11. The Fall of Roam (70 points | 22 comments)
12. An Efilist Just Bombed a Fertility Clinic. Was This Bound to Happen? (7 points | 2 comments)
13. The Journal of Imaginary Research (5 points | discuss)
14. Comparing Parallel Functional Array Languages: Programming and Performance (36 points | 3 comments)
15. Building my childhood dream PC (126 points | 49 comments)
16. Show HN: Python Simulator of David Deutsch’s "Constructor Theory of Time" (36 points | 5 comments)
17. Show HN: Buckaroo – Data table UI for Notebooks (71 points | 6 comments)
18. KDE is finally getting a native virtual machine manager called "Karton" (20 points | 2 comments)
19. Emergent social conventions and collective bias in LLM populations (42 points | 11 comments)
20. Yahtzeeql – Yahtzee solver that's mostly SQL (11 points | 6 comments)
21. How the humble chestnut traced the rise and fall of the Roman Empire (37 points | 3 comments)
22. Show HN: Hardtime.nvim – break bad habits and master Vim motions (153 points | 58 comments)
23. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (152 points | 15 comments)
24. Severed Fingers and 'Wrench Attacks' Rattle the Crypto Elite (10 points | 2 comments)
25. Dezyne Programming Language (20 points | 2 comments)
26. Mystical (346 points | 42 comments)
27. Show HN: Model2vec-Rs – Fast Static Text Embeddings in Rust (46 points | 5 comments)
28. Show HN: Stack Error – ergonomic error handling for Rust (21 points | 6 comments)
29. AniSora: Open-source anime video generation model (317 points | 178 comments)
30. Show HN: A web browser agent in your Chrome side panel (122 points | 55 comments)
